availability.description: The basal melt anomaly can be obtained via the ISMIP6 ftp server (email ismip6@gmail.com to obtain the login information) on a 1 km grid. Basal melt anomalies are uniform across a basin to accommodate all the possible initial grounding line positions. These anomalies are somewhat similar to the observed basal melt under floating ice, so they lead to a doubling of the ocean induced melting after 40 years for models with initial basal melting close to today's observations.
availability.name: InitMIP prescribed basal melt

description: Apply a prescribed anomaly of basal melting rate under floating ice, provided by ISMIP6, which simulates a doubling of sub-ice-shelf melting after 40 years of simulation for models with initial melting rates close to today’s observations.
name: InitMIP basal melting rate anomaly
rationale: To test the model response to anomalous melt beneath the floating portion of the Antarctic ice sheet.
longName: Basal melting rate anomaly for the ISMIP6 InitMIP experiments
keywords: ISMIP6, ISMIP6-specified input, InitMIP, basal melt anomaly
